results.title: Ah...we humans
results.brief_description: A non-narrated, animated cartoon with humorous sound effects, giving an understanding of how people react when confronted with behaviour patterns different from their own. Deals with a number of concepts related to groups and conflict: cultural awareness, beliefs and ignorance, scarce resources and the value of alliances. No other credits available.

results.title: Aguirre: wrath of God
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: A stunning and gruelling adventure about a band of Spanish conquistadors led by Aguirre, and their descent into the heart of darkness while exploring the Amazon in search of El Dorado, the legendary city of Gold. As the expedition moves further into the jungle, they leave reality behind and enter a dreamlike, otherwordly land of delusion and madness. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Cecilia Rivera, Ruy Guerra, Helena Rojo, Del Negro and Daniel Zacapa. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Agronomy
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Raymond Garceau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Describes the introduction of co-operative dairy farming in the eastern townships of Quebec to increase agricultural output and improve marketing methods. Recalls some of the difficulties encountered in the early days of the Agricultural Co-operative of Granby and cites the success of the Granby Co-operative as an example of what can be achieved when agricultural expert and farmer work in close co-operation.

results.title: Agriculture today in Japan
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the modern methods widely used in Japanese agriculture due to the influence of the country’s increasing industrialisation. Illustrates scientific farming methods, co-operative production and marketing.

results.title: Agriculture in Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the highly organized and productive farming methods of Japan, a small, densely populated country where every available square foot of land is valued. Profiles rice planting and its cultivation, stressing the high quotient of manual labour used in Japanese agricultural methods. The different kinds of produce are clearly defined and their cultivation topically treated.

results.title: Agonia = Agony
results.creator_credit: Elem Klimov, Semion Kutikov and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
In the final days of the Romanov regime (1613-1917), the ‘mad monk’ Rasputin wields power at the court. He is portrayed as a man completely out of touch with the people and political reality, immersed in sexual decadence and the lascivious manipulation of others. The relationship of Rasputin, the Czar and the Empress are explored in this historical drama, with the latter two falling under Rasputin’s spell. Klimov takes a docu-drama approach mixing colour re-enactments of historical events with simulated black and white newsreel footage. This film was completed in 1975 but due to its sympathetic portrayal of Czar Nicholas II, was not released until 1981

Credits: Producer, Semion Kutikov ; director, Elem Klimov ; writer, Semyon Lungin, Ilya Nusinov ; photography, Leonid Kalashnikov ; music, Alfred Shnitke.
Cast: Velta Linei, Alisa Freindlikh, Anatoly Romashin, Alexey Petrenko, A. Romantsov, S. Muchenikov.

results.title: Agnes, Maude & Pearly too
results.creator_credit: Erica Glynn, Alice Jacques, Charles Mitchell and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Two sisters meet up to play pokies on their deceased sister’s favourite pokie machine before scattering her ashes. Shortly afterward, their grief compounds and the truth of the past is revealed and confronted.

results.title: Aging
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordon, McGraw-Hill Films and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: Examines some popular, although often mistaken, attitudes towards the aged and their places in life. Discusses two major theories: the activity theory and leisure world with Dr Vern Bengston of USC and the disengagement theory.

results.title: Agility and tumbling
results.brief_description: The gymnastics performance of a class of ten to twelve year old girls. The girls do simple basic agility such as forward rolls, backward rolls, headstands, headstands and cartwheels, then gradually progress to combinations of these as well as handsprings, one handed cartwheels and round-offs.

results.title: Ageing Parents
results.brief_description: Many children regard their parents as a burden. This thought-provoking program explores what it feels like to get older. Elderly parents, their children and teenagers talk about how they relate to each other, their expectations and ways of keeping the lines of communication open - before it’s too late.
